forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 14 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night lingers over Downtown San Francisco, the city finds itself wrapped in a thick shroud of rainclouds, echoing the gentle rhythm of raindrops above. At this early hour, the air is cool, and the wind whispers insistently from the south, carrying with it a promise of moisture. One can almost feel the weight of the atmosphere, as if the sky were contemplating its next release, with a 60% chance of precipitation lingering like unspoken words. The streets appear dimly lit, but perhaps it's a perfect moment to cozy up in a favorite café, sipping on a warm brew as the world outside gathers its quiet rhythm.

As dawn breaks, Thursday will greet us with continued rain, the high creeping up to a mild 62 degrees. The clouds will remain stubbornly in place, hinting at a day more suited for introspection than for adventure. As temperatures begin their slow descent towards the afternoon, donning layers would be wise; perhaps a light waterproof jacket over a snug sweater to fend off the chill. Be prepared for gusts that steal the breath away, and an umbrella will be more than just a stylish accessory; it will be a trusty companion for the day ahead. With all this rain, it may not be the day for an impromptu stroll along the waterfront, but rather a chance to explore the hidden gems of the city—think art galleries, independent bookstores, or even the warmth of a local bakery, where the scent of fresh pastries might just rival the sweet respite from the rain.
